frame.name: Simple_name
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Term</fen> is the linguistic sign conventionally used by a <fen>Speaker</fen> to refer to a type of <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex> <fex name="Term">Perianth</fex> <m>is</m> a collective <t>term</t> <fex name="ent">for the outer whorls of the flower, which protect the reproductive parts during development</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The <fex name="Speaker">Polish</fex> <t>word</t> <fex name="ent">for it</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Term">czarnuszka</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Term
FE.definition:
<def-root>The linguistic sign that is used for referring to a type of <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>The French <t>term</t> for this is <fex name="ter">rime pauvre or rime faible</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that is conventionally referred to by a <fen>Term</fen>.
<ex>Jews are still waiting for the "annointed one" to come; their <t>word</t> <fex name="ent">for this</fex> is Messiah.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>A speaker or speech community that uses a <fen>Term</fen> to refer to a particular <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex> <fex name="ter">An antigen</fex> is <fex name="spe">biologists?</fex> <t>term</t> <fex name="ent">for an invading organism</fex>, such as the influenza virus.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: term.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a word or phrase used to describe a thing or to express a concept

lexUnit.name: word.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others
